TopicTitle: [1.0] XT Landertron - Smart Retrorockets for Landers and Spaceplanes v0.08 Oct 10

Articles.Content:
I just noticed from this thread the following that might affect the LandertronBox for certain new engines.

Quote

KSP Module change/improvement

  • ModuleEngine has a new thrustTransformMultipliers array. Before each thrustTransforms of the engine had a thrust of the total engine trust divided by thrustTransforms.count. Now each thrustTransforms has a thrust of total engine * thrustTransformMultipliers.

I mean, it will only be a factor when the thrustTransformMultipliers are not all equal, which probably won't bite us for a while but it should get fixed at some point. Unfortunately I broke my IDE by updating it (figures...) so I can't look into doing that yet myself. It should be an easy fix to just change a line or two in LandertronBox.engineThrust.

Big props @Kerbas_ad_astra et al for the update, many thanks! The box....are you set on keeping that model? Obviously function is more important (and I'm assuming the relevant bit is a module I can swap out and put in a new part if I want?), it's just....well, ugh, whatever. It's lovely. Thank you once again.

Awesome! Hope the mod still works fine with the latest updates of KSP (and RemoteTech).

It seems just what I need to finally land some probes :-D

Jeb was pleased to learn that the 1.2 update is proceeding smoothly -- in fact, it worked on the very first test flight!  (His landing would have been much faster if it hadn't worked the first time.)  I'll wait until the full 1.2 release to be sure, but if all stays going well, I'll have a shiny new release thread, KSP-AVC .version file, and everything.
Here's hoping that your HGR Community Update Pack is equally painless.

By odd coincidence, this release comes two years and two days after XanderTek's v0.08.

Version 0.14: Future Proofing

  • Added support for thrustTransformMultipliers.
  • Updated for KSP 1.2.
  • Added .version file.

There's also a new thread where I will track future releases (so long as I make them):

I cannot figure out what I'm doing wrong. I attach the Landertron box but it doesn't do anything. There are no options when I right click on it and under action groups it has no commands attached to it to select. So what gives?
Are you sure you grabbed a release (and didn't just grab the repo)?  You won't have the DLL that makes it work if you don't get the release.

On 12/11/2013 at 2:27 AM, XanderTek said:

Please see this post for a 1.0 patch until I have a chance to release a new version

The above is a link in the op that links back to itself.

 

I see this is a continuation by another person and there is already a new thread started to continue with. Maybe this thread should be locked to prevent confusion when it gets bumped by a new post.
